DataElement.preferredName: Kaposi Sarcoma Lesion Additional Information Specify
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text description of additional information related to the Kaposi sarcoma lesion.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A malignant neoplasm characterized by a vascular proliferation which usually contains blunt endothelial cells. Erythrocyte extravasation and hemosiderin deposition are frequently present. The most frequent site of involvement is the skin; however it may also occur internally. It generally develops in people with compromised immune systems including those with acquired immune deficiency syndrome (AIDS)._A localized pathological or traumatic structural change, damage, deformity, or discontinuity of tissue, organ, or body part._Added; extra; further._Knowledge derived from study, experience, or instruction that has been gathered or received by communication.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A malignant neoplasm characterized by a vascular proliferation which usually contains blunt endothelial cells. Erythrocyte extravasation and hemosiderin deposition are frequently present. The most frequent site of involvement is the skin; however it may also occur internally. It generally develops in people with compromised immune systems including those with acquired immune deficiency syndrome (AIDS).:A localized pathological or traumatic structural change, damage, deformity, or discontinuity of tissue, organ, or body part.

Concepts.definition: A malignant neoplasm characterized by a vascular proliferation which usually contains blunt endothelial cells. Erythrocyte extravasation and hemosiderin deposition are frequently present. The most frequent site of involvement is the skin; however it may also occur internally. It generally develops in people with compromised immune systems including those with acquired immune deficiency syndrome (AIDS).
A localized pathological or traumatic structural change, damage, deformity, or discontinuity of tissue, organ, or body part.
